description: Borrowed from Middle French consigner or directly from Latin cōnsignō (“furnish with a seal”), from con- + signō (“mark, sign”).

verbs.description: consign (third-person singular simple present consigns, present participle consigning, simple past and past participle consigned)

entries.meaning: (transitive, business) To transfer to the custody of, usually for sale, transport, or safekeeping.
(transitive) To entrust to the care of another.
(transitive) To send to a final destination.
examples: to consign the body to the grave

entries.meaning: To assign; to devote; to set apart.
To stamp or impress; to affect.
